column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: decade. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .@prefix ex: <http://example.org#> .ex:Decade a rdfs:Class ;  rdfs:comment "A specific span of ten years." .ex:hasStartYear a rdf:Property ;  rdfs:domain ex:Decade ;  rdfs:range xsd:dateTime ;  rdfs:comment "The starting year of a decade." .ex:hasEndYear a rdf:Property ;  rdfs:domain ex:Decade ;  rdfs:range xsd:dateTime ;  rdfs:comment "The ending year of a decade." .ex:containsEvents a rdf:Property ;  rdfs:domain ex:Decade ;  rdfs:range ex:Event ;  rdfs:comment "Events that occurred during a specific decade." .ex:Event a rdfs:Class ;  rdfs:comment "An important occurrence during a specific span of time." .ex:hasName a rdf:Property ;  rdfs:domain ex:Event ;  rdfs:range xsd:string ;  rdfs:comment "Name of the event." .ex:hasDate a rdf:Property ;  rdfs:domain ex:Event ;  rdfs:range xsd:dateTime ;  rdfs:comment "Date of the event." .```This ontology represents a class "Decade" which has properties like the start year, the end year, and the events that happened within it. We also define an "Event" class, which can have features like a name and a date.
